column5: Well my old Olympus digital finally crapped out on me this past week and i'm sorry to say cost our " team 2 " a 31" lake trout with no picture   Anyways i'm just looking for any advice on a small point and shoot digital that is waterproof and somewhat tough to take on my fishing/camping trips . I might go back with Olympus since the one I had was pretty good in bad weather and survived some real wild trips . What do you guys think ?
I use the Fuji finepix. It works well even under the water. Battery life is good as well
I vote Fuji FP as well. Great cameras , great battery life. I dunno if olympus has changed but they used to make you buy battery packs seperate, kept me from buying one.

I'm using a canon d10, simple, affordable, battery lasts forever and shock/water/abrasion/etc proof.  Zoom sucks but other than that I've been very happy with it (and it help up well in salt water during a barbados trip so I'm sure its fine here).

http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=70468   Same camera different day  http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=70523  Im very happy with it.  It,s the newer model.
